data.title: [Graphics] Separable Shader Programs
data.body:
Change shaders to use [program pipelines](https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Shader_Compilation#Separate_programs) instead of programs.

Proper use of pipelines should reduce API overhead. This should allow for more customization with shaders, particularly adding additional stages to a pipeline.  This also provides the opportunity to reuse compiled shaders instead of recompiling a shader for each program that uses it.

data.title: Feature: Fast Refreshing
data.body:
This does a few things:
1. Deprecates filepath.d in favor of resources.d
2. Added `Asset` abstract class for art assets, which keep track usage and source file path.
3. Implemented refreshing (as opposed to resetting), which updates Graphics, Config, Prefabs, Textures, Meshes, and Materials (pretty much everything that's not an object) in real time without changing any state. Reload still exists for when objects change.

Feedback, as always, is absolutely welcome.

data.title: [Input] XInput support

milestone.title: Version 1.0.0
milestone.description: At this point, Dash should be usable by a newcomer to game development who stumbles across the engine. This includes having solid documentation.

data.body: XInput is the currently accepted API in Windows to handle input devices such as gamepads and joysticks. Our [recent upgrade](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/pull/181) to Input was the first step towards supporting more types of input methods, and XInput is the next logical step forward.

data.title: Build File System Manager
data.body: This can allow us to keep better track of loaded assets, only reload changed assets, etc.

data.title: [Assets] Lazy object loading
data.body:
Right now Dash loads all meshes, textures, and prefabs at launch. Dash should offer more granular loading (and unloading) of assets during runtime.

One method to do this would be to build a list of all the objects that are available to load without loading them, then as game scripts and scenes reference objects they are loaded into memory.

On OSX 64 bit - dmd v2.065
I get the following error:

```
source/utility/input.d(326): Error: function utility.input.Input.mousePos has no return statement, but is expected to return a value of type Vector!(float, 2)
FAIL .dub/build/library-debug-posix.osx-x86_64-dmd-3C6E8969AD590B672545D425B0181F08 dash staticLibrary
Error executing command run: DMD compile run failed with exit code 1
```

data.title: Feature: Input Cleanup
data.body: Made input use some template magic that allows us to very easily add support for more devices later.

data.title: Feature: Directional Light Shadow Maps
data.body:
Directional light shadow maps are kind of hacked in for ImagineRIT with the help of a few magic numbers.
Caution: Since we don't have anything fancy for shadow maps yet, each shadow map will use about .28 GB of vram...it might not run on your machine.

I feel terrible about this, but they will be improved over the next few weeks.

data.title: [Input] Scroll wheel support
data.body: [This page](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms645617%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) leads me to think we can access it with our existing input system.

data.title: Fix robot and wolf animations
data.body: Small modification to animations so that both robot and wolf are supported.

data.title: Refactor: Drop Shared
data.body:
Shared is no more. Except in logging and concurrency, because we need it there.

You may notice that unittests currently fail, and that's on GL3N for having a failing test.

Please enjoy reading this diff.

data.title: [Graphics] Change texture color from code
data.body: If there were a grayscale texture, it would be cool if you could change the color of it using an RGB value in code. Is this remotely possible?

data.title: [Animation] More generic support
data.body:
- [ ] Animation should be generalized to not crash for different animation setups and have error messages for these non-working setups.
- [x] Fix minor bug on some werewolf animation frames.
- [x] Make sure robot file is supported in Spectral Robot Task Force

data.title: [Animation] Define animations from YAML
data.body:
We need some way to define animations in yaml. I don't know what form that will take yet, but I have a suggestion of how it might be done:

``` yaml

---
Name: Foo
Script:
    ClassName: foo.bar
Mesh: foo
Material: bar
Animations:
    Idle: foo_idle
    Run: foo_run
```

data.title: [Animation] Load and swap multiple animations
data.body: Add support for multiple animations and swapping between them.

data.title: Feature: Animation System
data.body:
Major animation push:
-Fully working animation system, tested with fbxtest and wolf
-Pause/play/stop working
-Comments/documentation completed
-Renaming/cleaning up
-Animating based on deltaTime

data.title: Feature: Behaviors
data.body:
This moves game object logic out of `GameObjects` children, and into children of `Behavior`. This does a number of things for us:
- `GameObject.createFromYaml` becomes much much simpler.
- An object can have multiple `Behavior`s on it.
- A `Behavior` can be added to an object after it is initialized.
- Scripts that don't take `onInitialize` arguments can now actually have an `onInitialize` method that is called after all yaml loading is complete.
- Decoupling scripts and objects paves the way for a polymorphic scripting system.

Down sides:
- This is very much a code breaking change. You can see the required changes to Sample Game [here](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Sample-Dash-Game/compare/feature;Behaviors).

data.title: [Assets] Don't load Thumbs.db
data.body:
Texture loader loads Thumbs.db even though it is unneeded (thanks Windows).

`Warning: Texture Thumbs exists more than once.`

data.title: Custom style for Global logger.
data.body:
Related to #163.
- Debug msgs have highest verbosity.
- With new styling API users can define custom logging levels. `OutputType` is reinstated to be used with logging system.

data.title: Cleanup: Config Cleanup

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
This moves most logic in Config out into the module scope, which means that you don't have to qualify all of your function calls with `Config`, and you can use UFCS to call like this: `node.tryFind( "My.Path", myPath )`.

Requires [`feature/ConfigCleanup`](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Sample-Dash-Game/compare/develop...feature%2FConfigCleanup) on Sample Dash Game.

data.title: Handle Textures with the Same Name

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
Texture images can have the same name with any file extension.  We should probably figure out if we want to do something when there are overlaps, and if not, document the order of preference it takes on file types so we can document it.

Example:
In folder I can have flat_n.png and flat_n.tga and I only access them through "flat_n"

data.title: Add hitboxes to GameObjects for mouse selection
data.body: Right now you have to click on an object _exactly_ to select it with the mouse. @zeDoctor  had the idea that you could have a hitbox used specifically for mouse selection that would give a grace area to clicks.

data.title: Feature: Single/Embedded YAML Document

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
This adds 2 major features to the YAML loading system:
1. All content can now be consolidated to a single `Content.yml` file. This is good for preparing for releases, as well as small games with little content.
2. The single YAML file can be embedded in the executable. This is done by adding `"versions": [ "ImportContent"]` to the `dub.json` file, and making sure to set `stringImportPaths` to the location of `Content.yml`. The advantage of this is that it means only art assets (textures and meshes) need to be distributed along side the game. This means that modding will become very difficult (unless purposefully left easy).

See the [`feature/SingleYamlDocument`](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Sample-Dash-Game/compare/feature;SingleYamlDocument) branch in sample game for more info.

data.title: [Input] Remove key events
data.body: Right now you can only add key events. Remove (and/or modify) would be desirable.
